FORMAT_OPTIONS.FORMAT_TYPE_HELP_TEXT: Specify a formatter to customize how its displayed. Common options are 'numberToString', 'stringToNumber', 'toCurrency','toDate', 'prefix', 'suffix', 'toUpperCase' , 'toLowerCase', 'maskData'
FORMAT_OPTIONS.NUMBER_TO_STRING_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Formats NUMBER to a STRING. Eg: If value is 12345.6789 and fraction size is 3, then formatted value is 12,345.679
FORMAT_OPTIONS.NUMBER_TO_PERCENTAGE_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Formats NUMBER to a PERCENT STRING. Eg: If value is 12345.6789 and fraction size is 3, then formatted value is 12,34,567.890%
FORMAT_OPTIONS.PREFIX_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: A prefix is prepended to the value. Eg: If value is aaa and prefix is AAA- then formatted value is AAA-aaa
FORMAT_OPTIONS.SLICE_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Creates a new Array or String containing a subset (slice) of the elements.
FORMAT_OPTIONS.STRING_TO_NUMBER_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Formats STRING to a NUMBER. Eg: If value is '123', then formatted value is 123
FORMAT_OPTIONS.SUFFIX_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: A suffix is appended to the value. . Eg: If value is aaa and suffix is -AAA then formatted value is aaa-AAA
FORMAT_OPTIONS.TIME_FROM_NOW_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Formats date and time to a relative time. Eg: If value is 5 PM and the current time is 6 PM, formatted value is 'an hour ago'
FORMAT_OPTIONS.TO_CURRENCY_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: If value is 12345.6789, fraction size is 3 and currency symbol is USD, then formatted value is $12,345.679
FORMAT_OPTIONS.TO_DATE_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Formats date to a string based on the given date pattern. Eg: If date pattern is yyyy, MMM dd, then the formatted value is 2001, Jan 01
FORMAT_OPTIONS.TO_DATETIME_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Formats date and time to a string based on the given date pattern. Eg: If date pattern is yyyy, MMM dd, H:M:S then the formatted value is 2001, Jan 01 12:30:20
FORMAT_OPTIONS.TO_TIME_FORMAT_HELP_TEXT: Formats time to a string based on the given time pattern. Eg: If date pattern is H:M:S then the formatted value 12:30:20

ACTIONS_MODAL.NAME: Name:
ACTIONS_MODAL.NAME_TOOLTIP: Enter name of the new variable
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_CLICK: The function to be triggered on click of Toaster
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_HIDE: The function to be triggered on hide of Toaster after the given duration
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_BEFORE_UPDATE: This event is triggered before the Logout Variable is updated. This event handler gives you the opportunity to manipulate the data before your variable is assigned this value. The order of events is: onBeforeUpdate, onResult, onBeforeDatasetReady, onSuccess, onCanUpdate
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_RESULT: This event is triggered after the Logout Variable is updated. onResult is triggered whether or not there was an error generated, i.e. it is triggered for both success & error situations. The order of events is: onBeforeUpdate, onResult, onBeforeDatasetReady, onSuccess, onCanUpdate
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_ERROR: This event is triggered if there is an error generated during the Service call.
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_BEFORE_DATASET_READY: This event is triggered just before the Variable's dataSet is updated with the response received from the target service on success. You can manipulate this data in a JavaScript function and return the same.
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_SUCCESS: This event is triggered after the Logout Variable is updated. onSuccess is triggered whenever a service returns successfully. The order of events is: onBeforeUpdate, onResult, onBeforeDatasetReady, onSuccess, onCanUpdate
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_CAN_UPDATE: A given logout variable may only be firing once at a given time; as such, a logout variable waiting for a response from the server will ignore any calls to update. Call canUpdate() if you want to find out if the logout variable is able to send a request. canUpdate also tests the result of any custom onCanUpdate method you've provided.
ACTIONS_MODAL.ON_TIMER_FIRE: Event to be triggered on the completion of the timer
ACTIONS_MODAL.OWNER_TOOLTIP: Select the scope of the variable, 'Page' variable is available only in that page while 'Application' variable is available throughout the app
ACTIONS_MODAL.PAGE_PARAM_PLACEHOLDER: Provide the value to selected page param
ACTIONS_MODAL.INPUT_FIELD_TOOLTIP: This section contains the fields that are input parameters to the selected service. You can provide them values by entering manually or binding it to a Applications Workbench component
ACTIONS_MODAL.J_USERNAME_TOOLTIP: You can provide value to this field or bind it to a Applications Workbench component (variable, widget, etc)
ACTIONS_MODAL.J_PASSWORD_TOOLTIP: You can provide value to this field or bind it to a Applications Workbench component (variable, widget, etc)
ACTIONS_MODAL.J_REMEMBER_ME_TOOLTIP: You can provide value to this field or bind it to a Applications Workbench component (variable, widget, etc)

DESIGNER.MESSAGE_PROGRESS_CODEGEN_DATABASE_DESC: Please wait while sources re-generation is in progress.

DESIGNER.MESSAGE_VCS_PROJECT_PULL_MESSAGE: The project needs to get the latest changes from Version Control System. Do you want to pull these changes?
DESIGNER.MESSAGE_VCS_PROJECT_PULL_MESSAGE_EXTRA: More changes are available for pull.
DESIGNER.MESSAGE_VCS_PULLING: Pulling the project changes from VCS
DESIGNER.METHOD_HELP: This property lists the operations available based on the service selected. Depending on the operation you select, operation-specific input parameters become available. To access these properties, select the Data tab
DESIGNER.MOVE_SELECTED_OPTIONS_SR_ONLY: Move Right Button Screen Reader Text
DESIGNER.MOVE_SELECTED_VALUES_SR_ONLY: Move Left Button Screen Reader Text
DESIGNER.NAME: Name
DESIGNER.NAME_HELP: Enter name of the new variable
DESIGNER.ON_BEFORE_CLOSE: Triggered before an existing connection(opened by the Variable) is closed. Returning false from here will abort the closing of the connection.
DESIGNER.ON_BEFORE_DATASET_READY: This event is triggered just before the Variable's dataSet is updated with the response received from the target service on success. You can manipulate this data in a JavaScript function and return the same.
DESIGNER.ON_BEFORE_MESSAGE_SEND: The event is triggered just before the Variable attempts to send a message to the target service through the existing connection. User has a chance at this point to validate and edit the data to be sent to the service. Returning false from this event will prevent the message to be sent to the service.
DESIGNER.ON_BEFORE_OPEN: The event is triggered just before the Variable attempts to establish a connection between the client and target Websocket service. If returned false from here, the connection establishment will be aborted.
DESIGNER.ON_BEFORE_UPDATE: This event is triggered before the ServiceVariable is updated. This event handler gives you the opportunity to manipulate the data before your variable is assigned this value. The order of events is: onBeforeUpdate, onResult, onBeforeDatasetReady, onSuccess, onCanUpdate
DESIGNER.ON_CAN_UPDATE: A given service variable may only be firing once at a given time; as such, a service variable waiting for a response from the server will ignore any calls to update. Call canUpdate() if you want to find out if the service variable is able to send a request. canUpdate also tests the result of any custom onCanUpdate method you've provided.
DESIGNER.ON_CONNECTION_CLOSE: Triggered after the connection is closed.
DESIGNER.ON_CONNECTION_ERROR: Triggered if an error is encountered in establishing a connection with the server in the open phase.
DESIGNER.ON_ERROR: This event is triggered if there is an error generated during the Service call.
DESIGNER.ON_MESSAGE_RECEIVE: The event is triggered on the Variable when a message is received from the Websocket service in an existing connection made by the Variable
DESIGNER.ON_NEW_DATA_HELP: Determine what to do with data received from the variable. 1. Refresh dataSet, dataSet will be updated with the data received. 2. Add as last record, data will be appended at the end of dataSet. Latest data will be the last record in dataSet 3. Add as first record, data will be prepended at the beginning of dataSet. Latest data will be the first record in dataSet
DESIGNER.ON_OPEN: The event is triggered right after a successful connection is established between client and the Websocket service through the Variable.
DESIGNER.ON_RESULT: This event is triggered after the Service Variable is updated. onResult is triggered whether or not there was an error generated, i.e. it is triggered for both success & error situations. The order of events is: onBeforeUpdate, onResult, onBeforeDatasetReady, onSuccess, onCanUpdate
DESIGNER.ON_SUCCESS: This event is triggered after the Service Variable is updated. onSuccess is triggered whenever a service returns successfully. The order of events is: onBeforeUpdate, onResult, onBeforeDatasetReady, onSuccess, onCanUpdate
DESIGNER.OWNER_HELP: Select scope of the variable, 'Page' variable is available only in that page while 'Application' variable is available throughout the app
DESIGNER.REQ_DATA_HELP: Check this if you want to trigger the variable on load. If checked, 'Page' variable will be triggered on page load while 'Application' variable will be triggered on application load
DESIGNER.SERVICE_HELP: Select the service out of imported/created services
DESIGNER.SHOW_SPINNER_HELP: Check this to show a spinner when the variable is invoked
DESIGNER.SPINNER_CONTEXT_HELP: This property specifies on which UI widget the spinner should show.
DESIGNER.SPINNER_HELP: This section contains the fields to configure the spinner. If configured, a spinner will be displayed in the UI while the variable is in-flight.
DESIGNER.SPINNER_MESSAGE_HELP: The message to be displayed below the spinner.
DESIGNER.SUBTITLE: Subtitle
DESIGNER.TITLE: Title
DESIGNER.UPDATE_DATA_HELP: Check this if you want to trigger the variable automatically on change of any input fields(under Data section)

WIDGET.ACCORDION_DESCRIPTION: An accordion is a menu composed of vertically stacked headers that reveal more details when triggered.
WIDGET.ANCHOR_DESCRIPTION: Navigation link within the application or an external URL.
WIDGET.ALERT_MODAL_DESCRIPTION: A special dialog box that when displayed, requires an immediate action.
WIDGET.AUTO_COMPLETE_DESCRIPTION: The box combines a text input and list of options. It allows you to select from a list of values that are dynamically matched as you type.
WIDGET.BADGE_DESCRIPTION: A prominent indicator for counts, accompanying notifications.
WIDGET.BAR_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A bar chart presents grouped data with vertical bars with lengths proportional to the values that they represent.
WIDGET.BUTTON_DESCRIPTION: A widget that triggers actions, processes, and navigation.
WIDGET.CARD_DESCRIPTION: A simple layout container for groupings of data: a header with title and optional action dropdown, some main content, and a footer.
WIDGET.CHECKBOX_DESCRIPTION: A checkbox allows you to choose one or multiple of a predefined set of options.
WIDGET.COLUMN_DEFINITION_NOT_FOUND: Column definition not found for the selected field.
WIDGET.CONFIRM_MODAL_DESCRIPTION: A special dialog box that when displayed requires consent to complete the action.
WIDGET.CONTAINER_DESCRIPTION: An enclosing element that wraps the widgets placed within, mostly used for embedding partial pages.
WIDGET.DATETIME_DESCRIPTION: A compact, flexible component to choose date and time as a popup or displayed inline. It can present multiple months and allows for date-range selection. The component can optionally highlight today's date, include disabled dates and footer buttons.
WIDGET.DESIGN_MODAL_DESCRIPTION: A small window to communicate information and to prompt for a response. The content of the dialog is customizable.
WIDGET.DONUT_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A type of graph in which a circle is divided into sectors that represent a proportion of the whole, with an inner circle showing the summary.
WIDGET.DROPDOWN_MENU_DESCRIPTION: A pull-down menu used for defining navigation structure within the application or for external links.
WIDGET.FILE_UPLOADER_DESCRIPTION: A widget that pops up a file browsing window to select files for uploading.
WIDGET.FORM_DESCRIPTION: A group of input elements put together to post data, typically updating data through a web service call.
WIDGET.FORM_BUILDER_VALID_NODE_MESSAGE: Selected field can be bound to the widget.
WIDGET.FORM_BUILDER_INVALID_NODE_MESSAGE: Selected field cannot be bound due to type mismatch.
WIDGET.GRID_DESCRIPTION: Division of content area into cells or grids based on the 12-column fluid grid system, which helps in proper placement of the widgets for responsive design.
WIDGET.GRID_BUILDER_RANGE_ERROR: Value must be in the range of 1 to 10
WIDGET.GROUPED_BAR_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A clustered, multi-series bar chart representing data in more than one category.
WIDGET.HORIZONTAL_BAR_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A horizontal bar chart presents grouped data with horizontal bars with lengths proportional to the values that they represent.
WIDGET.HORIZONTAL_GROUPED_BAR_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A clustered, multi-series bar chart representing data horizontally in more than one category.
WIDGET.HORIZONTAL_STACKED_BAR_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A chart that uses horizontal bars to show comparisons between categories of data, but with the ability to break down and compare parts of a whole.
WIDGET.ICON_BUTTON_DESCRIPTION: A widget for displaying a comprehensible icon as a button.
WIDGET.INFO_BUTTON_DESCRIPTION: Provides for concise, context-sensitive help in a flexible popup with optional header and footer containers.
WIDGET.INLINE_ALERT_DESCRIPTION: An alternative to toasts for applications and use cases where dedicated real estate is available for these messages.
WIDGET.INPUT_DESCRIPTION: A widget to accept data from the user.
WIDGET.LABEL: Label
WIDGET.LABEL_DESCRIPTION: A non-editable text like a heading to describe another widget.
WIDGET.LEFT_NAVIGATION_DESCRIPTION: Left navigation panels can be minimized to increase screen real estate in the main content area whether menus are hidden completely or minimized to an icon toolbar. The expanding node pattern supports generic or custom iconography for parent nodes.
WIDGET.LINE_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A line chart displays information as a series of data points called ‘markers’ connected by straight line segments.
WIDGET.MASTHEAD_DESCRIPTION: The principal identifying and unifying brand element across our products.
WIDGET.MULTISELECT_DESCRIPTION: The multi-select component allows you to quickly make selections from a drop-down list.
WIDGET.NUMBER_CARD_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A numbered card is a widget to display specific data.
WIDGET.PAGINATOR_DESCRIPTION: Paginator comprises of forward and back navigation arrows with a dropdown that provides direct input to load a specific page in the record set and tailor the number of records displayed.
WIDGET.PICTURE_DESCRIPTION: A widget to display images in the project.
WIDGET.PIE_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A type of graph in which a circle is divided into sectors that represent a proportion of the whole.
WIDGET.PROGRESSBAR_DESCRIPTION: An actual indicator of activity progress in time or percentage.
WIDGET.RADIO_GROUP_DESCRIPTION: Radio buttons provide a mechanism to select mutually exclusive options. That is, only one option from the available list can be selected. Radio button groups can be oriented inline or block.
WIDGET.RANGE_SLIDER_DESCRIPTION: A widget control with a handle that can be moved right and left (horizontal slider) on a bar to select a value from within the range of allowed values.
WIDGET.SELECT_DESCRIPTION: A drop-down list bound to a fixed dataset that provides several options.
WIDGET.SHUTTLE_LIST_DESCRIPTION: Used to move properties or objects (like permissions) from one list to another. This component is keyboard operable, supports drag and drop, drag re-ordering of both lists, and double-clicking to select and move in a single action.
WIDGET.SHUTTLE_TABLE_DESCRIPTION: Used to move properties or objects from one table to another.
WIDGET.LIST_DESCRIPTION: A widget that offers a structured alternative to tables when your content is simple and concise.
WIDGET.LOADING_BUTTON_DESCRIPTION: A widget that adds micro-interaction feedback to the common button including text changes before, during, and after the button action is initiated, along with a spinner and colour changes.
WIDGET.SLIDER_DESCRIPTION: A widget control with a handle that can be moved right and left (horizontal slider) on a bar to select a value.
WIDGET.SPARKLINE_CHART_DESCRIPTION: Sparklines are very simple, and their main purpose is showing the trend of something unique. They can be made to display not just the current situation, but its change over time.
WIDGET.SPINNER_DESCRIPTION: A widget for visual indicator of an activity in progress.
WIDGET.STACKED_BAR_CHART_DESCRIPTION: A chart that uses bars to show comparisons between categories of data, but with the ability to break down and compare parts of a whole.
WIDGET.TAB_BUILDER_REQUIRED_NAME_ERROR: Name field of tab cannot be empty.
WIDGET.TAB_BUILDER_DUPLICATE_NAME_ERROR: Name field of tab cannot be duplicate.
WIDGET.TABLE_DESCRIPTION: A widget that presents a tabular view of data and allows actions.
WIDGET.TABSET_DESCRIPTION: Multiple containers placed in a single window, with only one active container and headings that allow navigation to other containers.
WIDGET.TEMPLATE_LIST_DESCRIPTION: Grouping of items as a list that is in a <ul><li> structure.
WIDGET.TAG_DESCRIPTION: Tags are employed to add highly visible meta-attributes to objects.
WIDGET.TEXT_AREA_DESCRIPTION: Allows for multiple rows of data to be shown and entered.
WIDGET.TOGGLE_DESCRIPTION: A widget that allows switching between two different options.
WIDGET.TREE_DESCRIPTION: A widget that can be used to display data in a hierarchical format.
WIDGET.LABEL_DELETE_RECORD_MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to delete this record?

WEB_SERVICES.DELETE_TEXT: Are you sure you want to delete web service -
WEB_SERVICES.REST_DESCRIPTION: A REST (Representational State Transfer) web service is composed of resources accessed through unique URLs (requests) and returned as XML or JSON responses.
WEB_SERVICES.SEARCH_NOT_FOUND: The search did not return any results. Modify search criteria and try again.
WEB_SERVICES.SOAP_DESCRIPTION: SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol) is a standard XML protocol for exposing and calling web services. A SOAP service is described by a Web Services Definition Language (WSDL) document.
WEB_SERVICES.TITLE: Web Services
WEB_SERVICES.WEBSOCKET_DESCRIPTION: WebSockets represent the next evolution of web communications a full-duplex, bidirectional communications channel that operate through a single socket over the Web.
WEB_SERVICES.WELCOME_TEXT: Bring the power of third party APIs into your applications
